content.description:
Start somewhat low in the crack on a really good sidepull. Follow the crack up and left to a good hold and then dyno for the top. The left arete is off. 

  A SDS to this line has been done, but the holds down low are somewhat pliable and are ready to explode!
content.protection: 1-2 pads. This has a really flat landing (uncommon for Haycock!)
content.location: The easiest way to approach this boulder is by accessing North Mountain through the entrance to Stoney Garden Rd. Follow the trail for 0.3 miles (almost until the trail starts breaking fully to the right and heading towards the mini summit of North Mountain). Break left and head into the woods for about 400 feet. You'll pass several small clusters of rocks which yield some potentially good lines.
